Articles.Content:
I exhibit both wavelike and particle like behavior .

I throw a spoon at the next poster

I realize that there is no spoon

I drop a lemon on the next poster from orbit

You realize that dV you can provide was tiny compared to orbital speed, and on the next turn catch the lemon with the spaceship windscreen.

I push a watermelon out of crew hatch, on the way of the next poster, and safely deorbit.

I perform a slight course correction, the watermelon misses me by several kilometers.

I detonate a nuclear weapon in space over the next poster. and yes my space capsule is shielded appropriately why do you ask

Happily, the next poster is already 200 km below (he had landed after deorbit a post before) and even didn't notice the explosion far in the space.

But the explosion took off 3 large communication satellites, and their owners want to meet and thank the person who did it.

Edited September 15, 2016 by kerbiloid

I shot the owners

I send invisible, silent, AT-AT's and sectopods after the next poser

Unfortunately, they still take up space and have mass. They also still emit radiation in other regions of the EM spectrum. I detect them with a wide-spectrum scanner and shoot enough explosives at them to send them on a solar escape trajectory.

19 minutes ago, DaMachinator said:

Unfortunately, they still take up space and have mass. They also still emit radiation in other regions of the EM spectrum. I detect them with a wide-spectrum scanner and shoot enough explosives at them to send them on a solar escape trajectory.

I capture the sectopods and hand them over to XKOM's Dr. Kahlen

I throw an alligator through the window of the next poster

Dis is a knoaf!

*terrified alligator screaming*

The frightened alligator flees and attacks the next poster.

I shoot the alligator with a gun (Chekhov's gun) and then turn it on the next guy. (Edit: The gun, not the alligator)

The Chekhov thing means that the gun was mine to use because I needed it.

Edited September 15, 2016 by greenTurtle1134
Clarification.
http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsGun

I pull a John Cena while pulling a Chuck Norris and mix in a little infinty, and voila, complete invincibility.

 

I let the next poster do what he wants to me because I know I won't feel a thing, and if I do, will immediately win.
Well yeah, but so what. It's the next poster who should worry that they've just had a nuclear bomb pressed up against their eyeball and detonated.

Remember, invincibility.

 

I shove a nuke down the next posters throat after coating it with super-glue.

I roll 1d20 == 20 to evade. Your attack misses.

I shoot the next poster with the USN's prototype railgun.

You roll a 1=critical failure.

I poke the next user

And I poke back with a sword.

I shoot the next user with a swiss assault rifle. And those things are pin-point accurate, just so you know.

I coincidentally have a temporary existence failure just before the bullet reaches my expected location.

I pour a bucket of 20-sided dice on the next poster from 2 miles above the ground.

They're all 1's. You miss.

I summon mighty renegade Femshep to murder the next poster

I summon the might of Chekhov's Gun to help me. It turns out this time it was a simple asteroid, which hits a critical component, and the whole ship explodes.

 

I send the U.S.S. Enterprise after the next poster.

 

On 9/16/2016 at 9:24 AM, Dark Junior said:

I poke the next user

Wait...THAT WAS IN COMIC SAAAAANS!

The simple illogicalness of that thing makes it disintegrate right after it leaves the dock.

The debris of the USS Enterprise hit the next user.

Whoosh! they are missed.

I use a Land Shark to murder next user

I use Deus Ex Machina Land Tank to defeat puny Land Shark.

 

The next user is now certainly banished into an inescapeable, never ending lava pit of eternal death.

Good thing I'm immune to lava. And pits. 

 

I punch the next user. Really hard. Hard enough to shatter concrete.

Fortunately, concrete is far more brittle than a person.

I give the next poster an existential crisis.
